Class WordPair

  • java.lang.Object
    • WordPair

  • public class WordPair
extends java.lang.Object
    Works as the "struct" data structure holding the word pairs' strings and helper functions.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • createWordPair

        public static WordPair createWordPair(java.lang.String word,
                      java.lang.String pair,
                      java.lang.String comment)
        Creates a WordPair from the given Strings. Validates data given to itself and calls the private constructor that is not to be used by itself. Returns a WordPair object if it is successful, and null in all other cases.
        Parameters:
        word - The String to be used as the shown word in the word pair.
        pair - The String to be used as the "answer" pair of the shown word.
        comment - The String to be used as the comment. Is not essential, and can be passed as an empty String.
        Returns:
        a WordPair object if successful, null if unsuccessful.

      • createWordPair

        public static WordPair createWordPair(java.lang.String word,
                      java.lang.String pair)
        Creates a WordPair from the given Strings. Calls createWordPair(String, String, String) internally. Returns a WordPair object if it is successful, and null in all other cases.
        Parameters:
        word - The String to be used as the shown word in the word pair.
        pair - The String to be used as the "answer" pair of the shown word.
        Returns:
        a WordPair object if successful, null if unsuccessful.

      • getWord

        public java.lang.String getWord()
        Gets the currently set word from a given WordPair.
        Returns:
        A String object that contains the currently set word.

      • getPair

        public java.lang.String getPair()
        Gets the currently set pair word from a given WordPair.
        Returns:
        A String object that contains the currently set pair word.

      • getComment

        public java.lang.String getComment()
        Gets the currently set comment from a given WordPair.
        Returns:
        A String object that contains the currently set comment.

      • setWord

        public boolean setWord(java.lang.String word)
        Takes in a String object, that is then used to set the word for a given WordPair.
        Parameters:
        word - a String object that will be used to set the word
        Returns:
        true if successful, otherwise returns false.

      • setPair

        public boolean setPair(java.lang.String pair)
        Takes in a String object, that is then used to set the pair word for a given WordPair.
        Parameters:
        pair - a String object that will be used to set the pair word
        Returns:
        true if successful, otherwise returns false.

      • setComment

        public boolean setComment(java.lang.String comment)
        Takes in a String object, that is then used to set the comment for a given WordPair.
        Parameters:
        comment - a String object that will be used to set the comment
        Returns:
        true if successful, otherwise returns false.

      • setContents

        public boolean setContents(java.lang.String word,
                  java.lang.String pair,
                  java.lang.String comment)
        Takes in three String objects, that will then be used to change the contents of a given WordPair at once. Tries to leave the WordPair unchanged in case of some value failing to be set.
        Parameters:
        word - a String object that will be used to set the word
        pair - a String object that will be used to set the pair word
        comment - a String object that will be used to set the comment
        Returns:
        true if successful, otherwise returns false.

      • equalsInContent

        public boolean equalsInContent(WordPair obj)
        Compares this WordPair against the given WordPair. Returns true if the contents of the given WordPair equal the contents of the compared WordPair.
        Parameters:
        obj - The WordPair given to compare this WordPair against
        Returns:
        true if the given WordPair represents a WordPair with the exactly same contents as the compared WordPair, false otherwise.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a "prettified" String representation of the WordPair object's contents.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A String object that represents the contents of a WordPair.
